CatDescriptText: Harry Maybury, teletype repairman, Monroeville and Eva Smith, domestic, Fifth Ward, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, January 14, 1961, pg. B1 with question: "At what age should young folks be allowed to have unchaperoned parties?" Harry Maybury's answer reads: "If the parents are in the house, I would say between the ages of 12 and 17.  At the other ages, the kids are wilder.  Actually they are not stable until around 25."  Eva Smith's answer reads: "Around 16 or 17 years of age.  I think they can take care of themselves better at that age than when younger."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Harry Maybury wearing hat, eyeglasses, striped scarf, and herringbone coat, standing in front of building; Portrait of Eva Smith wearing dark scarf over head and light colored coat, standing in front of building
